Class Converter.RomanToNum

  • java.lang.Object
    • Converter.RomanToNum
  • Enclosing class:
    Converter
    class Converter.RomanToNum
extends java.lang.Object
    Roman Numeral to Number Logic. This class holds the logic for the conversion of a basic roman numeral to a number. It takes the input from the getRoman method.

    It implements the multiple roman numeral rules (nearly) successfully, and shows relevant error messages. If the numeral is valid, the roman numerals are simply equated to their respective number value.

    • Method Detail

      • processRoman

        protected void processRoman()
        Process the input, and output final number if valid. By utilising the rulesCheck() and outputNum() methods, the roman numeral is processed and the final number is outputted.

      • rulesCheck

        private boolean rulesCheck()
        Validate input. By using the multiple rule checking methods: checkNumeralValid checkNumeralSize checkNumeralAmount The input is validated.
        Returns:
        true if number is valid. false if not

      • checkNumeralValid

        private void checkNumeralValid()
        Check for mis-input. Checks if the character at the current index is contained within the converted HashMap. If it isn't, isValid is set to false.

      • checkNumeralSize

        private void checkNumeralSize()
        Compare first and second char in pair. If the second numeral is greater in value than the first, isValid is set to false. The values for each of the characters are sourced from the converter HashMap.

        The values compared exclude any values contained in the s_converted HashMap.

      • checkNumeralAmount

        private void checkNumeralAmount()
        Compare groups of characters. If one unique numeral appears consectutively in a group of 4, isValid is set to false.

      • outputNum

        private int outputNum()
        Output number. This is run once the input is validated. It checks whether the current character is subtractive or basic, and invokes the relevant method.
        Returns:
        final number to be outputted

      • isSubtractive

        private boolean isSubtractive​(int index)
        If numeral is subtractive. This runs through the input in pairs, and if it finds a 'subtractive' numeral, it gets the equivalent value from the s_converted HashMap.
        Parameters:
        index - current index of the character in the roman String
        Returns:
        true if the current number is subtractive, false if not

      • basicNum

        private void basicNum​(java.lang.String basic)
        Basic roman numeral process. Simply gets the roman numeral from the converted HashMap, and sets number equal to it plus result. The result variable keeps the previous value of the number variable, thus iteratively increasing the value each time until complete.
        Parameters:
        basic - the current basic numeral

      • complexNum

        private void complexNum​(java.lang.String subtractive)
        Subtractive roman numeral process. Very similar behaviour to the basicNum method. The only difference being that the values are accessed from the s_converted HashMap.
        Parameters:
        subtractive - the current subtractive pair
